zkp_architecture.highlight: Index tables generated synchronously per block, merged asynchronously into bigger tables
Protocol will hash only up to 64-block tables; larger tables proven off-chain
Full history lookup estimated at 40KB proof size with log-squared complexity
Recursive proofs needed to aggregate work from multiple provers without perfect coordination

implementation_approach.highlight: Draft specification published in Go; will need Rust rewrite for production
ZKVM can internally handle recursive proofs; unclear if all expose public API
SHA-2 or SHA-3 recommended as starting point; ZKVMs have accelerators for both
Separate proof logic: core table merging vs recursive proof aggregation

proof_system_details.highlight: STARK proofs ~1MB but post-quantum; SNARK proofs <1KB but not post-quantum
Several hundred KB STARK proofs acceptable for hourly updates; no on-chain verification needed
